title: [BUG] fix cancel all txns when be is down bug
body:
Commit 93315748 Cancel all txns whose coordinate BE is down.
but this commit import a bug,
one host have several bes, when only one be is down , then
all redicted to the alive host bes tasks will be abort.

abortTxnWhenCoordinateBeDown should add be port
define one be, but the change may very large.

so we should not initiative abort txns, just wait txt timeout

title: [BUG] fix streaming_preagg dcheck cause be down
body:
in debug modequery memory not enough, may cause be down
fe set useStreamingPreagg true, but be function CreateHashPartitions check is_streaming_preagg_ should false.

then casue core dump.
```
*** Check failure stack trace: ***
    @          0x2aa48ad  google::LogMessage::Fail()
    @          0x2aa6734  google::LogMessage::SendToLog()
    @          0x2aa43d4  google::LogMessage::Flush()
    @          0x2aa7169  google::LogMessageFatal::~LogMessageFatal()
    @          0x24703be  doris::PartitionedAggregationNode::CreateHashPartitions()
    @          0x2468fd6  doris::PartitionedAggregationNode::open()
    @          0x1e3b153  doris::PlanFragmentExecutor::open_internal()
    @          0x1e3af4b  doris::PlanFragmentExecutor::open()
    @          0x1d81b92  doris::FragmentExecState::execute()
    @          0x1d840f7  doris::FragmentMgr::_exec_actual()
```

we should remove DCHECK(!is_streaming_preagg_)

title: [Manager] Improve agent part code
body:
## Proposed changes

1. Ensure the idempotence of fe, be service installation 
2. When the agent service restarts, get the installed service from the server and save it to the agent
3. The configuration of be and fe can be sent to the agent side during installation
4. Support fe installation, and when issuing the fe configuration file fe.conf, choose whether to automatically create a metadata directory according to the meta_dir value in the configuration file
5. Support be installation, and when the be configuration file be.conf is issued, select whether to automatically create a data storage directory according to the storage_root_path value in the configuration file
6. Support the registration of the existing doris cluster to the agent
7. Support one agent node can install multiple services, such as fe, be
8. Some other optimizations, such as interface parameter verification, code formatting, etc.
9. Remove assembly module

title: [BUG] Fix printing ReservationTrackerCounters cause BE crash when mem_limit is reached
body:
When the memory usage of BE reaches mem_limit, printing ReservationTrackerCounters through MemTracker may cause BE crash in high concurrency.

ReservationTrackerCounters is not actually used in the current Doris, and the memory tracker in Doris will be redesigned in the future.

title: [Export] Support export job with label
body:
## Proposed changes

```
EXPORT TABLE xxx
...
PROPERTIES
(
    "label" = "mylabel",
    ...
);
```

And than user can use label to get the info by SHOW EXPORT stmt:
```
show export from db where label="mylabel";
```

For compatibility, if not specified, a random label will be used. And for history jobs, the label will be "export_job_id";

Not like LOAD stmt, here we specify label in `properties` because this will not cause grammatical conflicts,
and there is no need to modify the meta version of the metadata.

title: [Memory Usage] Implement segment lru cache to save memory of BE
body:
## Proposed changes

This CL mainly changes:

1. Use a lru cache to cache all opened segments(Only for beta rowset, alpha rowset remain unchanged)

    In the previous implementation, the segment instance is an object belonging to the rowset,
    so if the rowset exists, the segment will always exist, resulting in memory usage.
    In fact, the segment instance is only used in the data reading process. In principle, the segment
    can be closed after the data reading is completed.

    So here I use a lru cache to cache all open segments, and use SegmentLoader to uniformly manage
    segment loading and closing.

    Before:
    ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2899462/137098798-a09ee11c-4a99-48d3-b9c4-e50c8439f17c.png)

    After using cache, the memory will no longer increase continously:
    ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2899462/137096097-03785244-b524-430d-8bee-cf0348a1f60a.png)

    In addition to the cached segments being eliminated by the lru algorithm, there will also be threads
    that regularly clean up segments that have not been used for a period of time.

    Also, I modify the lru cache implementation, to add a `type` for the lru cache.
    The type is either SIZE or NUMBER. SIZE is the default type, and NUMBER means the capacity of cache
    is based on the number of cached entries, not the size of cached entries.

    This is because currently we can not precisely calculate the memory usage of each opened segments.
    So we have to use "number" to limit the max cached segments. But if later we get size, better to use SIZE.

2. Optimize the usage statistics of lru cache

    In the previous implementation, the usage of lru cache is only based on the size of cache value.
    But for some cases, the cache key is larger than the value. So it is better to use both key and value
    size to calculate the usage of lru.

2. Let BE report immediately the first time it receive heartbeat from FE

    If not do so, even if the backend is alive with success heartbeat, user can not create table because the
    disk info is not reported yet.
    And also add a random sleep for the report process to avoid too many reports proceed at same time.

## Types of changes

title: [Optimize][RoutineLoad] Avoid sending tasks if there is no data to be consumed
body:
## Proposed changes

This PR mainly changes:

1. Avoid sending tasks if there is no data to be consumed
    By fetching latest offset of partition before sending tasks.(Fix #6803 )

2. Add a `preCheckNeedSchedule` phase in update() of routine load.
    To avoid taking write lock of job for long time when getting all kafka partitions from kafka server. 

3. Upgrade librdkafka's version to 1.7.0 to fix a bug of "Local: Unknown partition"
    See https://github.com/edenhill/librdkafka/issues/3295

4. Avoid unnecessary storage migration task if there is no that storage medium on BE.
    Fix #6804

title: bugfix: big_int * big_int product overflow
body:
[bug discription] while query with multi where conditions, such as where dt in (20210926,20210919) and hour<=13, will cause int * int product overflow result. and then in the function extend_scan_key will call range.convert_to_fixed_value() mistakenly.

for a big range[_low_value, _high_value) , mass value will be inserted into _fixed_values, result in oom finally.

title: [Feature][Step1] Support lateral view FE part
body:
## Proposed changes

The syntax:
```
select k1, e1 from test lateral view explode_split(k1, ",") tmp as e1;
```
```explode_split``` is a special function of doris,
which is used to separate the string column according to the specified split string,
and then convert the row to column.
This is a conforming function of string separation + table function,
and its behavior is equivalent to explode in hive ```explode(split(string, string))```

The implement:
A tablefunction operator is added to the implementation to handle the syntax of the lateral view separately.
The query plan is following:
```
MySQL [test]> explain select k1, e1 from test_explode lateral view explode_split (k2, ",") tmp as e1;
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Explain String                                                            |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| PLAN FRAGMENT 0                                                           |
|  OUTPUT EXPRS:`k1` | `e1`                                                 |
|                                                                           |
|   RESULT SINK                                                             |
|                                                                           |
|   1:TABLE FUNCTION NODE                                                   |
|   |  table function: explode_split(`k2`, ',')                             |
|   |                                                                       |
|   0:OlapScanNode                                                          |
|      TABLE: test_explode                                                  |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------+
```

## Types of changes

body:

When the text is imported, there may be separators in the data;
Therefore, support json format import.
Need setting parameters (only json array format is provided, so it must be set in pairs)

title: Fix duplicate result in colocated agg node
body:
## Proposed changes

Fixed #6726

If the plan fragment contains colocated agg plan node, it will be a colocated fragment.
The scan range and backend id of colocated fragment instance should be differnt from ordinary scheduler logic.
Tablets in the same bucket must fall on the same be.
For example, for the same bucket in different partitions,
even though the tablet id is different, they must be scheduled to the same be for scan node.

1. Fix bug of UNKNOWN Operation Type 91

title: [Optimize] Use compact mode to send query plan thrift data structure.
body:
## Proposed changes

In some cases, the query plan thrift structure of a query may be very large
(for example, when there are many columns in SQL), resulting in a large number
of "send fragment timeout" errors.

This PR adds an FE config  `use_compact_thrift_rpc` to control whether to transmit
the query plan in a compressed format.

Using compressed format transmission can reduce the size by ~50%. But it may reduce
the concurrency by ~10%. Therefore, in the high concurrency small query scenario,
you can choose to turn off compaction.

title: [Bug] Cache cannot sense the modification of the view
body:
## Proposed changes

Modifying the view is equivalent to modifying the sql, but because the sql string has not changed, the query will hit the cached result before the view is modified.

Fix the bug that the cache cannot perceive view modification:
- Add `updateTime` field to record the view update time
- Use `originalSql + latestViewUpdateTime` as the input of the md5 function to generate a sql_key

title: [Optimize][Stream load] Speed up stream load 3x
body:
## Proposed changes
In the huge data stream load workload, the load is too slow. the cause is skiplist usage `% 4` to generate random height, so I change to `& 3` to achieve high perfomance.

test doris: 1 fe, 1 be
test table:
```sql
CREATE TABLE `test_table` (
  `id` int(11) NULL COMMENT "",
  `uid` varchar(255) NULL COMMENT ""
) ENGINE=OLAP
DUPLICATE KEY(`id`, `uid`)
DISTRIBUTED BY HASH(`id`) BUCKETS 10
PROPERTIES (
  "replication_num" = "1",
  "in_memory" = "false",
  "storage_format" = "V2"
);
```

and insert 10 million rows like this
```
0,74c5ecf4-ef1d-4247-bae8-04ecdda291c5
1,87f02aaf-a5bc-428c-8879-06fd40d68409
2,056dbc2e-4ac8-4d7f-ab7b-3aefd6fa1086
3,d22bfb72-986e-46f2-b4cd-8493a681d640
4,0fe30303-958b-4f10-8641-08a98881e668
5,63de2f71-0751-4005-8d1e-5bf4275d6ce2
6,f35a042b-0343-4a28-9ec9-2eb000a5883b
```

the origin stream load result is:
```json
{
    "TxnId": 365,
    "Label": "20210916163323",
    "Status": "Success",
    "Message": "OK",
    "NumberTotalRows": 10000000,
    "NumberLoadedRows": 10000000,
    "NumberFilteredRows": 0,
    "NumberUnselectedRows": 0,
    "LoadBytes": 448888890,
    "LoadTimeMs": 59205,
    "BeginTxnTimeMs": 0,
    "StreamLoadPutTimeMs": 2,
    "ReadDataTimeMs": 28885,
    "WriteDataTimeMs": 59183,
    "CommitAndPublishTimeMs": 19
}
```

After optimize:
```json
{
    "TxnId": 372,
    "Label": "20210916170250",
    "Status": "Success",
    "Message": "OK",
    "NumberTotalRows": 10000000,
    "NumberLoadedRows": 10000000,
    "NumberFilteredRows": 0,
    "NumberUnselectedRows": 0,
    "LoadBytes": 448888890,
    "LoadTimeMs": 19940,
    "BeginTxnTimeMs": 0,
    "StreamLoadPutTimeMs": 1,
    "ReadDataTimeMs": 5500,
    "WriteDataTimeMs": 19917,
    "CommitAndPublishTimeMs": 20
}
```
